item.title: Wendy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Wendy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I can't go back to yesterday because I was a different person then." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Atul Gawande
item.description: "We look for medicine to be an orderly field of knowledge and procedure. But it is not. It is an imperfect science, an enterprise of constantly changing knowledge, uncertain information, fallible individuals, and at the same time lives on the line. There is science in what we do, yes, but also habit, intuition, and sometimes plain old guessing. The gap between what we know and what we aim for persists. And this gap complicates everything we do." -- Atul Gawande

item.title: Wendy add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Pete McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember, it's an easy place to be at home in, Ireland. I think the people are very skilled at relating. I notice, watching the different nationalities on the mountain, the fluidity of interaction the Irish people have with the visitors, and with each other. It's a skill that's less developed in other nationalities, and it's so instinctive it doesn't even look like a skill." -- Pete McCarthy

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Pete McCarthy
item.description: "But once you cross the Shannon - even though geographically you have only come a short distance - different rules of time apply, and most people still understand the crucial secret of human happiness: that it's better to do a few things slowly, than a lot of things fast." -- Pete McCarthy

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and methodically knocking people's hats off - then, I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Wendy add a quote by John Green
item.description:
"Some people don't understand the promises they're making when they make them," I said.
"Right, of course. But you keep the promise anyway. That's what love is. Love is keeping the promise anyway." -- John Green

item.title: Wendy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Without pain, how could we know joy?' This is an old argument in the field of thinking about suffering and its stupidity and lack of sophistication could be plumbed for centuries but suffice it to say that the existence of broccoli does not, in any way, affect the taste of chocolate." -- John Green

item.title: Wendy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Iâ€™m on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend." -- John Green

item.title: Wendy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "One swing set, well worn but structurally sound, seeks new home. Make memories with your kid or kids so that someday he or she or they will look into the backyard and feel the ache of sentimentality as desperately as I did this afternoon. It's all fragile and fleeting, dear reader, but with this swing set, your child(ren) will be introduced to the ups and downs of human life gently and safely, and may also learn the most important lesson of all: No matter how hard you kick, no matter how high you get, you can't go all the way around." -- John Green

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "We should be careful of the insults we fling at others, lest they return and land at our feet, newly minted to apply to those who had first coined them." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "Mma Ramotswe was right: evil repaid with retribution, with punishment, had achieved half its goal; evil repaid with kindness was shown to be what it really was, a small, petty thing, not something frightening at all, but something pitiable, a paltry affair." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "A society has no chance of success if its women are uneducated..." -- Khaled Hosseini
